title: Formula for Gravitational Force
text: The acceleration due to gravity g at the surface of the Moon is given by the equation:g $$=$$ \frac{G \cdot M}{r**2}.

title: Calculate the Distance
text: The total distance between the center of the Moon and the center of the Earth is about 384,400 km. Subtract the distance from the Earth's center to the Earth-Moon center of mass (4700 km): $$r=$$ 384,400\text{km} - $$4700\text{km}=3.797$$ \times 10**8\text{m}

title: Plug in the Values
text: Substitute G, M, and $$r$$ into the formula for g: what is g $$=$$ $$\frac{6.674$$ \times 10**{-11}\text{Nm}**2/\text{kg}**2 \cdot $$7.35$$ \times 10**{22}\text{kg}}{(3.797 \times 10**8\text{m})**2}?
